page.title: 18MEDIA IN ABERDEEN 1
page.content: The B.B.C at Beechgrove House,Grampian T.V. at Queen's Cross and Northsound the local independent radio station at Kingsgate area all in our D block situated closely together in Aberdeen's west end. The B.B.C studio was opened in 1938 and broadcasts radio and T.V.Its programmes concentrate mainly on farming,countryside and gardening."The Beechgrove Garden" is its best nationally known programme(with Jim and George giving gardening tips in Doric".There is also a daily round of Grampian news in "Reporting Scotland". Grampian T.V. opened in 1961 and its transmission area now stretches from the Shetland Isles down to Tayside and across to the Western Isles.It broadcasts for 6 hours 30 mins daily with a wide range of programmes including some in Gaelic.
